The loan of Arsenal attacker Joel Campbell has been proving to be a very good deal for Sporting. Arsene Wenger finally agreed to let Capmbell out in the summer, after Sporting had made several attempts to sign the player.

The Portuguese club released their yearly accounts on Thursday, and as revealed by the newspaper Record, they paid only €412k to have the Costa Rican player for one year.

CapturarDespite not having a regular place in the starting eleven, Campbell has been very useful for Sporting.

In his 12 appearances (starting only five), he has three goals and one assist. That’s much better than Lazar Markovic from Liverpool, for whom the Portuguese club paid three times more for a temporary deal.

Der Spiegel's Ozil article is meaty. Just trying to find some snippets without too much weight or legal tangles.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

This is some of what Der Spiegel is claiming, via Football Leaks documents. There's an awful lot, be patient.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

Der Spiegel: 'In Ozil's declarations of taxation, sufficient information, explanations and supporting documents were missing.'


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

Therefore Ozil was called 'to appear on September 5, 2014, for a hearing in the authorities' premises.' Neither Ozil or advisors turned up.

Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

That angered the inspector further who demanded all information on Ozil's contracts, both Madrid & Arsenal, other income, everything.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

A lot back and forthing went on, and, with the information they got, the Spanish authorities deemed Ozil owed tax on agent fees.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

Ozil's former agent Reza Fazeli had been paid €600k in 2011 and 2012 by Madrid, but it was deemed Ozil should have paid this, so tax due.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

Then when he moved to Arsenal there were further argument over where Ozil would pay tax as part of the move. This seems largely resolved.


Sport Witness ‏@Sport_Witness 10h

Then there's the disagreement between Ozil and his father, subsequent payments between them. No huge current tax case, from what is obvious.



Sport Witness
‏@Sport_Witness

Ozil is paid €10.2m per year by Arsenal, + €1.8m a year for getting to CL group stages, + €1.2m a year signing on fee, + image rights.
